results.title: Scottish Premiership: What did we learn from the weekend's games?

results.description: Hearts comfortably overcame St Mirren 5-2 on Saturday, with the second goal coming from an unfortunate own goal by Sean McLoughlin in the first half.
results.shortTitle: Watch: St Mirren go behind to comical own goal
results.title: Watch: St Mirren go behind to a comical own goal against Hearts

thumbnail.altText: St Mirren go behind to comical own goal

results.description: Hearts, under caretaker manager Austin MacPhee, pick up their first home win since March as they put five goals past St Mirren. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Heart of Midlothian 5-2 St Mirren

results.description: Managerless Hearts clamber away from the Scottish Premiership relegation zone with a thrilling seven-goal victory over St Mirren.
results.shortTitle: Managerless Hearts claim rare home win
results.title: Heart of Midlothian 5-2 St Mirren: Caretaker Austin MacPhee records first win

results.description: Catch up with all the team news and stats for the six games taking place before the international break, and choose your preferred XI.
results.title: Scottish Premiership team news, stats & selectors

results.description: Goals from Mohamed Elyounoussi and James Forrest keep Celtic at the top of the Scottish Premiership as St Mirren drop to the bottom.
results.title: Highlights: Celtic 2-0 St Mirren

results.description: Two early second-half strikes keep Celtic top of the Scottish Premiership on goal difference and drop St Mirren to bottom spot.
results.shortTitle: Two goals in nine minutes keep Celtic top
results.title: Celtic 2-0 St Mirren: Two early second-half strikes keep hosts top

results.description: St Mirren's Junior Morais is taken to task by BBC Scotland Sportscene pundit Steven Thompson for his jewellery faux pas as the striker comes on as a substitute. (UK only)
results.title: Watch: St Mirren's Junior Morais gets an earful for his jewellery faux pas from BBC pundit

thumbnail.altText: St Mirren's Junior Morais and manager Jim Goodwin

results.description: Gary Dicker's goal beats St Mirren and moves Kilmarnock up to third in the Scottish Premiership. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Kilmarnock 1-0 St Mirren

results.description: Kilmarnock move up to third in the Scottish Premiership after Gary Dicker's second goal in two games is enough to beat St Mirren at Rugby Park.
results.shortTitle: Kilmarnock up to third after Dicker goal
results.title: Kilmarnock 1-0 St Mirren: Hosts up to third in Premiership after Gary Dicker goal

thumbnail.altText: Gary Dicker celebrates his goal for Kilmarnock

results.description: St Johnstone's problems continue after they fall to a 2-0 defeat to St Mirren. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: St Mirren 2-0 St Johnstone

results.description: St Mirren manager Jim Goodwin has stated that his side won't get carried away with their 2-0 win over St Johnstone despite it being their first victory since the start of August.
results.shortTitle: Watch: St Mirren won't get carried away with win - Goodwin
results.title: Jim Goodwin: St Mirren manager says side 'won't get carried away'

thumbnail.altText: 'We won't get carried away with win'

results.description: St Mirren earned a rousing win in Paisley as their first goals in four games ensured St Johnstone remain the only side without a Scottish Premiership win.
results.shortTitle: St Mirren inflict more misery on St Johnstone
results.title: St Mirren 2-0 St Johnstone: hosts end barren run with comfortable win

results.description: League Two Elgin City score two late goals to shock Airdrieonians and reach the quarter-finals of the Scottish Challenge Cup.
results.shortTitle: League Two pair reach last eight
results.title: Scottish Challenge Cup: League Two pair Stenhousemuir & Elgin City reach last eight

thumbnail.altText: Matheus Machado (right) celebrates his goal to make it 3-0 with David Carson
